intro: Amblyanthera versicolor, commonly known as the variable false heath, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heaths and heaths. The plant is characterized by its small, showy flowers that display a range of colors, including white, pink, and red. Its leaves are typically small and leathery, adapted to thrive in nutrient-poor soils. Amblyanthera versicolor is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
